intro: Amphibromus quadridentulus, commonly known as the four-toothed arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological preferences, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
